9.11.17  6:44 am   What do you think about the future? Will humans extinguish themselves with another world war?

     that seems counter productive

      Will we remain forever in this state, where money mean everything, and corruption is normal, where popular things are popular because of fashion, even if they are completely useless(spinners), where people believe in democracy, even if only if you are really rich you can afford to make a decent election campaign, so if you are poor you can't become president, so actually very few can become presidents, making this an oligarchy, where future is forgotten in favor of present, so polluting is ok, where some people so rich they can't possibly spend all their money want more and more, to the point of sacrificing thousands of people, I am talking about wars, where people are ready to play on the most weak sides of our humanity to make money (drugs, and much more really), where having extremely poor countries is ok for all the others, "let's just think of our probl ems and ignore them", where some people decide the opinion everyone should have, and make all the others have it using anything that can be used, including disgusting things like isis, where you can't trust a person you've just met, because he may be willing to harm you, where there are many people ready to make damage with no reason, where if you are different then there will absolutely be groups of people hating you. Are we stuck here forever?

     we've barely been here for even an instant so far

     I know we kind of got better since the middle ages, but stuff is still pretty bad, so I am very afraid we won't get much better. Good luck to you, sorry for this stuff.

9.11.17  3:10 am   I'm having trouble writing a good song because I come up with these really awesome chord progressions, but I am struggling with turning them into songs with good melodies. I know I can start over so I can start with a solid melody and then add the chords, but I really want to use the chords I already have and like for something. any tips on getting past this hurdle?

      maybe it's time to figure out what the song is about, or find out some of the words to the song. or if the song must be instrumental, then try to find out what the song is going to be used for, where it will be located, and/or what it will be associated with. trying to come up with melodies blind with any of those elements will usually feel like an empty and impossible task

9.10.17  5:55 pm   If you have 3 quarter note triplets (3:2) that start on the offbeat of 1 ('and' of 1) where would the 2nd quarter note triplet hit in terms of beat 2?

     the second 6th of beat 2. so if you divide beat 2 into 6 subdivisions it would be the second subdivision, which would also be the 8th subdivision out of 24 in the entire bar (4/4)
